SeoMetaPart.PageTitle: About MCR Solicitors | Expert Legal Services in Manchester
SeoMetaPart.MetaDescription: Learn about MCR Solicitors, a LEXCEL accredited law firm providing expert immigration, family law, and personal injury services in Manchester since 2010.
SeoMetaPart.MetaKeywords: about MCR Solicitors, Manchester solicitors, legal services Manchester, immigration lawyers, family law solicitors

Subheadline.Text: Trusted legal expertise in Manchester since 2010. LEXCEL accredited and committed to achieving the best outcomes for our clients.

Content.Html:
MCR Solicitors is a LEXCEL accredited law firm based in Manchester, providing expert legal services since 2010. We specialise in Immigration Law, Family Law, and Personal Injury claims.

Our Mission

To provide accessible, professional legal services that put our clients first. We believe everyone deserves quality legal representation, regardless of their background or circumstances.

Why Choose MCR Solicitors?

  • LEXCEL Accredited - The Law Society's quality mark for legal practice management and client care
  • SRA Regulated - Fully regulated by the Solicitors Regulation Authority
  • Expert Team - Solicitors with years of experience in their specialist areas
  • Client Focused - We take time to understand your needs and keep you informed
  • Transparent Pricing - Clear fee structures with no hidden costs

Our Values

Integrity - We act honestly and ethically in all our dealings.

Excellence - We strive for the highest standards in everything we do.

Compassion - We understand our clients are often going through difficult times.

Accessibility - We make legal services approachable and understandable.

SectionText.Text: We'd love to hear from you. Contact us today to discuss how we can help with your legal needs.

SeoMetaPart.PageTitle: Contact MCR Solicitors | Get Legal Help Today
SeoMetaPart.MetaDescription: Contact MCR Solicitors in Manchester for expert legal advice. Call 0161 466 1280 or visit us at 1024 Stockport Road, Manchester M19 3WX.
SeoMetaPart.MetaKeywords: contact MCR Solicitors, Manchester solicitors contact, legal advice Manchester, free consultation

Subheadline.Text: Get in touch with our expert legal team. We're here to help with all your legal needs.

FormSubtitle.Text: Fill out the form below and we'll get back to you within 24 hours.

SuccessMessage.Text: Thank you for your message. We will contact you shortly.

SeoMetaPart.PageTitle: Immigration Solicitors Manchester | UK Visa & Immigration Services
SeoMetaPart.MetaDescription: Expert immigration solicitors in Manchester. We handle UK family visas, work visas, business visas, asylum claims, and appeals. Contact us for professional immigration advice.
SeoMetaPart.MetaKeywords: immigration solicitors Manchester, UK visa lawyers, immigration advice, visa applications, work permits UK

Subheadline.Text: Expert immigration advice and representation. From visa applications to asylum claims, we guide you through every step of your immigration journey.

Content.Html:
MCR Solicitors provides expert immigration advice and representation for individuals, families, and businesses. Our experienced immigration team handles all types of UK visa and immigration matters.

Our Immigration Services

  • UK Family Visas - Spouse, partner, parent, and child visas
  • UK Work Visas - Skilled Worker, sponsor licences, and work permits
  • Business & Investment Visas - Innovator, Start-up, and investor routes
  • British Citizenship - Naturalisation and registration applications
  • Asylum & Human Rights - Protection claims and refugee status
  • Visa Extensions - Extending or switching your visa
  • Indefinite Leave to Remain - Settlement applications
  • Appeals - Challenging Home Office decisions

Why Choose Our Immigration Team?

Our immigration solicitors have a deep understanding of UK immigration law and Home Office procedures. We provide clear, practical advice and work tirelessly to achieve the best possible outcome for your case.

SectionText.Text: Whatever your immigration needs, our specialist team is here to help. Contact us for a consultation.

SeoMetaPart.PageTitle: Family Law Solicitors Manchester | Divorce & Child Custody Lawyers
SeoMetaPart.MetaDescription: Compassionate family law solicitors in Manchester. We handle divorce, child custody, financial settlements, and domestic abuse cases with sensitivity and expertise.
SeoMetaPart.MetaKeywords: family law solicitors Manchester, divorce lawyers, child custody solicitors, family solicitors, matrimonial law

Subheadline.Text: Sensitive and professional family law advice. We understand the emotional challenges you face and provide compassionate legal support.

Content.Html:
Family matters require sensitivity, understanding, and expert legal knowledge. Our family law team provides compassionate, professional support during what can be the most challenging times of your life.

Our Family Law Services

  • Divorce - No-fault divorce proceedings handled with care
  • Judicial Separation - An alternative when divorce isn't suitable
  • Financial Settlements - Fair division of assets and property
  • Child Arrangements - Custody, access, and parenting plans
  • Domestic Abuse - Emergency protection and injunctions
  • Pre/Post-Nuptial Agreements - Protecting your assets

Our Approach

We understand that every family situation is unique. We take time to listen and understand your circumstances, then work with you to find the best way forward. Where possible, we encourage mediation and negotiation, but we're fully prepared to represent you in court when necessary.

Children Come First

In all matters involving children, we prioritise their welfare and wellbeing above all else, working to achieve outcomes that protect and nurture family relationships.

SectionText.Text: Our family law team is here to help you through difficult times. Contact us for a confidential consultation.

SeoMetaPart.PageTitle: Personal Injury Solicitors Manchester | No Win No Fee Claims
SeoMetaPart.MetaDescription: Expert personal injury solicitors in Manchester. No win, no fee representation for road traffic accidents, workplace injuries, and medical negligence claims.
SeoMetaPart.MetaKeywords: personal injury solicitors Manchester, no win no fee, accident claims, compensation lawyers, injury claims

Subheadline.Text: Injured through no fault of your own? We fight for the compensation you deserve. No win, no fee representation available.

Content.Html:
If you've been injured through no fault of your own, you deserve compensation. MCR Solicitors' personal injury team works on a No Win, No Fee basis, meaning there's no financial risk to you.

Our Personal Injury Services

  • Road Traffic Accidents - Car, motorcycle, cyclist, and pedestrian injuries
  • Workplace Injuries - Accidents at work and industrial diseases
  • Medical Negligence - Clinical negligence and hospital errors

What We Can Claim For

  • Pain, suffering, and loss of amenity
  • Loss of earnings (past and future)
  • Medical expenses and treatment costs
  • Care and assistance
  • Travel expenses
  • Property damage

No Win, No Fee

We understand that when you're injured, the last thing you need is financial stress. That's why we offer No Win, No Fee agreements (Conditional Fee Agreements). If your claim isn't successful, you won't pay a penny in legal fees.

Time Limits

Personal injury claims must generally be made within 3 years of the accident. Don't delay - contact us today to protect your right to compensation.

SectionText.Text: Get the compensation you deserve with no financial risk. Call us for a free case assessment.

SeoMetaPart.PageTitle: UK Family Visa Applications | Spouse & Partner Visas Manchester
SeoMetaPart.MetaDescription: Expert help with UK family visa applications. We assist with spouse visas, partner visas, parent visas, and child visas. High success rates and professional guidance.
SeoMetaPart.MetaKeywords: UK family visa, spouse visa UK, partner visa, family reunion visa, immigration solicitors

Subheadline.Text: Reunite with your loved ones in the UK. Our experienced immigration solicitors help families navigate the visa process with high success rates.

Content.Html:
At MCR Solicitors, we understand that being separated from family members is one of the most difficult experiences you can face. Our dedicated immigration team has helped hundreds of families reunite in the UK through successful visa applications.

Types of Family Visas We Handle

  • Spouse/Partner Visas - For married partners or those in civil partnerships
  • Fianc√©(e) Visas - For couples planning to marry in the UK
  • Unmarried Partner Visas - For couples who have lived together for 2+ years
  • Parent Visas - For parents of children settled in the UK
  • Child Visas - For children joining parents in the UK
  • Adult Dependent Relative Visas - For elderly relatives requiring care

Why Choose MCR Solicitors?

Our immigration specialists have an exceptional track record with family visa applications. We understand the stringent requirements and work meticulously to ensure your application meets all Home Office criteria.

SectionText.Text: Book a consultation with our immigration experts today. We'll assess your eligibility and guide you through the entire application process.

SeoMetaPart.PageTitle: UK Work Visa Applications | Skilled Worker Visas Manchester
SeoMetaPart.MetaDescription: Professional assistance with UK work visa applications. Skilled Worker visas, sponsor licences, and employment-based immigration. Expert guidance from experienced solicitors.
SeoMetaPart.MetaKeywords: UK work visa, Skilled Worker visa, work permit UK, sponsor licence, employment visa

Subheadline.Text: Build your career in the UK. Our immigration experts help professionals and businesses navigate the Skilled Worker visa system successfully.

Content.Html:
MCR Solicitors provides expert guidance for individuals seeking to work in the UK and businesses looking to sponsor overseas workers. We handle all types of work-related immigration matters.

Our Work Visa Services Include

  • Skilled Worker Visas - The main route for skilled professionals
  • Sponsor Licence Applications - Help businesses become approved sponsors
  • Global Talent Visas - For leaders and potential leaders in their fields
  • Intra-Company Transfer Visas - For multinational company transfers
  • Health and Care Worker Visas - Fast-track route for healthcare professionals
  • Senior or Specialist Worker Visas - For high-level business transfers

For Employers

We assist businesses of all sizes with sponsor licence applications and compliance. Our team ensures your organisation meets all Home Office requirements to sponsor overseas workers.

SectionText.Text: Whether you're a professional seeking employment or a business needing to sponsor staff, we're here to help.

SeoMetaPart.PageTitle: UK Business & Investment Visas | Innovator & Start-up Visas
SeoMetaPart.MetaDescription: Expert guidance on UK business and investment visas. Innovator Founder visas, Start-up visas, and investor routes. Build your business future in the UK.
SeoMetaPart.MetaKeywords: UK business visa, Innovator visa, investment visa UK, entrepreneur visa, Start-up visa

Subheadline.Text: Establish and grow your business in the UK. Expert guidance on Innovator Founder visas, investor routes, and business immigration.

Content.Html:
MCR Solicitors helps entrepreneurs, investors, and business professionals establish themselves in the UK. We provide comprehensive guidance on all business immigration routes.

Business Visa Categories

  • Innovator Founder Visa - For experienced entrepreneurs with innovative business ideas
  • Start-up Visa - For those starting a business in the UK for the first time
  • Expansion Worker Visa - For overseas businesses establishing a UK presence
  • UK Ancestry Visa - For Commonwealth citizens with UK-born grandparents
  • Global Business Mobility Visas - Various routes for international business activities

Endorsement Body Introductions

We work with approved endorsement bodies to help you secure the endorsement required for Innovator Founder and Start-up visas.

SectionTitle.Text: Ready to Start Your UK Business?

SectionText.Text: Let our business immigration specialists assess your options and create a tailored strategy for your UK business venture.

SeoMetaPart.PageTitle: British Citizenship Applications | Naturalisation Solicitors Manchester
SeoMetaPart.MetaDescription: Expert assistance with British citizenship and naturalisation applications. Registration, naturalisation, and citizenship by descent. Achieve your goal of becoming British.
SeoMetaPart.MetaKeywords: British citizenship, naturalisation UK, citizenship application, become British citizen, UK passport

Subheadline.Text: Make the UK your permanent home. Our expert solicitors guide you through the citizenship application process with care and precision.

Content.Html:
Becoming a British citizen is a significant milestone that opens doors to permanent residency, voting rights, and the ability to hold a British passport. MCR Solicitors has helped hundreds of clients successfully navigate the naturalisation process.

Who Can Apply?

  • Naturalisation - For those who have lived in the UK for 5+ years (or 3 years if married to a British citizen)
  • Registration - For British nationals overseas, certain children, and those with specific entitlements
  • Citizenship by Descent - For those born abroad to British parents
  • Stateless Persons - Special provisions for those without nationality

Requirements for Naturalisation

To qualify for naturalisation, you typically need to demonstrate:

  • Indefinite Leave to Remain (ILR) or EU Settled Status
  • 5 years' continuous residence (3 if spouse of British citizen)
  • Good character and no serious criminal convictions
  • Knowledge of English language and Life in the UK
  • Intention to continue living in the UK

Our Services Include

We provide comprehensive support including eligibility assessment, document preparation, form completion, and representation throughout your application.

SectionText.Text: Book a consultation to discuss your eligibility and start your journey to British citizenship today.

SeoMetaPart.PageTitle: Asylum & Human Rights Claims | Refugee Solicitors Manchester
SeoMetaPart.MetaDescription: Compassionate legal support for asylum seekers and human rights claims. We protect the rights of refugees and vulnerable individuals seeking protection in the UK.
SeoMetaPart.MetaKeywords: asylum solicitors, refugee lawyers, human rights claims, asylum application UK, protection claims

Subheadline.Text: Compassionate legal support when you need it most. We protect the rights of those seeking safety and protection in the UK.

Content.Html:
If you fear persecution in your home country, you may be entitled to claim asylum in the UK. Our experienced asylum solicitors provide sensitive, expert representation to help you secure the protection you need.

Who Can Claim Asylum?

Under the 1951 Refugee Convention, asylum may be granted to those who:

  • Face persecution due to race, religion, nationality, political opinion, or membership of a social group
  • Cannot safely return to their home country
  • Have a well-founded fear of serious harm

Our Asylum Services

  • Fresh Asylum Claims - Initial applications for those newly arrived in the UK
  • Further Submissions - Fresh claims based on new evidence or circumstances
  • Human Rights Applications - Article 3 and Article 8 claims under the European Convention
  • Humanitarian Protection - For those who don't qualify as refugees but need protection
  • Appeal Representation - First-tier and Upper Tribunal appeals

Urgent Cases

If you are in immigration detention or facing imminent removal, contact us immediately. We can act quickly to protect your rights.

SectionText.Text: Our compassionate team is here to help you through this difficult time. Contact us for a confidential consultation.

SeoMetaPart.PageTitle: UK Visa Extensions & Variations | Immigration Solicitors Manchester
SeoMetaPart.MetaDescription: Professional help with extending or varying your UK visa. Maintain your legal status and avoid complications with expert immigration advice.
SeoMetaPart.MetaKeywords: visa extension UK, visa variation, extend stay UK, change visa category, immigration help

Subheadline.Text: Stay legal, stay protected. Expert help extending your visa or switching to a different category to maintain your status in the UK.

Content.Html:
If your visa is approaching its expiry date, or your circumstances have changed and you need to switch visa categories, MCR Solicitors can help. Timely action is crucial to avoid becoming an overstayer.

Common Extension Applications

  • Spouse/Partner Visa Extensions - Extending your initial 2.5-year visa
  • Skilled Worker Visa Extensions - Continuing your employment in the UK
  • Student Visa Extensions - For ongoing studies or PhD students
  • Graduate Visa Applications - Post-study work visa after completing your degree
  • Long Residence Applications - For those with 10+ years continuous residence

Switching Visa Categories

You may be able to switch to a different visa category from within the UK. Common switches include:

  • Student to Skilled Worker
  • Graduate to Skilled Worker
  • Visitor to Spouse (in limited circumstances)
  • Any visa to Family route

Why Timing Matters

You must apply before your current visa expires. Once your visa is valid, your leave is protected under Section 3C while your application is pending.

SectionText.Text: Contact us today to discuss your extension or switching options. Early action gives you the best chance of success.

SeoMetaPart.PageTitle: Immigration Appeals | Administrative Review Solicitors Manchester
SeoMetaPart.MetaDescription: Challenge Home Office decisions with expert legal representation. Immigration appeals, administrative reviews, and judicial reviews. Don't give up on your case.
SeoMetaPart.MetaKeywords: immigration appeal, administrative review, challenge visa refusal, Home Office appeal, tribunal representation

Subheadline.Text: Don't give up. If your visa application was refused, we can help you challenge the decision and fight for the outcome you deserve.

Content.Html:
Receiving a refusal from the Home Office can be devastating, but it's often not the end of the road. MCR Solicitors has an excellent track record of overturning unfair decisions through appeals and administrative reviews.

Types of Challenges

  • First-tier Tribunal Appeals - Full appeal hearings for human rights, asylum, and EEA cases
  • Upper Tribunal Appeals - Appeals on points of law against First-tier decisions
  • Administrative Reviews - Challenging errors in points-based system decisions
  • Judicial Reviews - Challenging unlawful Home Office decisions in the High Court
  • Fresh Applications - Submitting new applications with additional evidence

Time Limits Apply

Appeals and administrative reviews have strict time limits:

  • Administrative Review: 14 days (UK) or 28 days (overseas)
  • Appeal: Usually 14 days from decision date
  • Judicial Review: Within 3 months

Our Success Rate

Our experienced advocates have successfully overturned countless unfair refusals. We carefully analyse decisions to identify grounds for challenge and build compelling cases.

SectionText.Text: Time is critical. Contact us immediately to discuss your options for challenging the decision.

SeoMetaPart.PageTitle: ILR Applications | Indefinite Leave to Remain Solicitors Manchester
SeoMetaPart.MetaDescription: Expert help with Indefinite Leave to Remain (ILR) applications. Settlement in the UK, permanent residence rights, and pathway to citizenship.
SeoMetaPart.MetaKeywords: ILR application, indefinite leave to remain, settlement UK, permanent residence, UK settlement visa

Subheadline.Text: Secure your future in the UK with permanent settlement. ILR gives you the freedom to live and work without restrictions.

Content.Html:
Indefinite Leave to Remain (ILR), also known as settlement, allows you to live and work in the UK without any immigration restrictions. It's a crucial step on the path to British citizenship.

Routes to ILR

  • 5-Year Route - Spouse/Partner visas, Skilled Worker visas, and most work visas
  • 10-Year Long Residence - Continuous lawful residence for 10 years
  • Ancestry - After 5 years on an Ancestry visa
  • Asylum/Humanitarian Protection - After 5 years of protection status
  • Domestic Violence - Early settlement for victims leaving abusive relationships

Key Requirements

Most ILR applications require you to demonstrate:

  • Continuous residence for the qualifying period
  • No excessive absences from the UK
  • Knowledge of English (B1 level or above)
  • Life in the UK test pass
  • Good character and no criminal record concerns

Benefits of ILR

With ILR, you can work without restrictions, access public funds, and apply for British citizenship after 12 months.

SectionText.Text: Let us help you with your ILR application. We'll ensure every requirement is met for the best chance of success.

SeoMetaPart.PageTitle: Deportation Defence | Removal Appeals Solicitors Manchester
SeoMetaPart.MetaDescription: Urgent legal help if you're facing deportation or removal from the UK. We fight to protect your rights and keep families together.
SeoMetaPart.MetaKeywords: deportation defence, removal appeal, immigration detention, deportation solicitors, stop deportation

Subheadline.Text: Facing removal from the UK? We provide urgent legal support to protect your rights and fight for your right to stay.

Content.Html:
If you're facing deportation or removal from the UK, you need expert legal representation immediately. MCR Solicitors provides urgent assistance to those facing removal, including those in immigration detention.

When We Can Help

  • Deportation Orders - Challenging deportation decisions for foreign criminals
  • Removal Decisions - Fighting removal for overstayers or those with refused applications
  • Detention Cases - Bail applications and challenging unlawful detention
  • Emergency Injunctions - Stopping imminent removals
  • Fresh Claims - Submitting new human rights or asylum claims

Grounds for Challenge

Deportation may be challenged on grounds including:

  • Family life in the UK (Article 8 ECHR)
  • Risk of harm in your home country (Article 3 ECHR)
  • Unduly harsh impact on British citizen children
  • Rehabilitation and reduced risk to public
  • Private life established over many years

Emergency Assistance

If you have removal directions set, contact us immediately. We can act urgently to apply for injunctions to stop removal while your case is considered.

SectionText.Text: If you or a loved one is facing removal, contact us immediately for urgent legal assistance. We're available 24/7 for emergencies.

SeoMetaPart.PageTitle: EU Settlement Scheme | EEA Applications Manchester
SeoMetaPart.MetaDescription: Help with EU Settlement Scheme applications, late applications, and EEA family permits. Protecting EU citizens' rights in the UK post-Brexit.
SeoMetaPart.MetaKeywords: EU Settlement Scheme, EUSS, EEA application, EU citizens UK, Brexit immigration

Subheadline.Text: Protecting EU citizens' rights in the UK post-Brexit. Expert help with EUSS applications, late applications, and family permits.

Content.Html:
Following Brexit, EU citizens and their family members need to secure their immigration status in the UK. MCR Solicitors has extensive experience helping EU nationals protect their rights under the EU Settlement Scheme.

Our EU/EEA Services

  • Late EUSS Applications - Helping those who missed the deadline with valid reasons
  • Pre-Settled to Settled Status - Upgrading to permanent status after 5 years
  • EUSS Family Permits - Bringing family members to the UK
  • Joining Family Members - Applications to join EU citizens in the UK
  • Derivative Rights - Zambrano, Chen, and Ibrahim carers
  • Administrative Reviews - Challenging EUSS refusals

Late Applications

If you missed the 30 June 2021 deadline, you may still be able to apply if you have reasonable grounds. We can assess your case and help submit a late application with supporting evidence.

Common Issues

We help with complex cases including gaps in residence, criminal convictions, incomplete documentation, and derivative rights claims.

SectionText.Text: Don't let Brexit uncertainty affect your future. Contact us to secure your status in the UK.

SeoMetaPart.PageTitle: Divorce Solicitors Manchester | No-Fault Divorce Experts
SeoMetaPart.MetaDescription: Experienced divorce solicitors in Manchester. We guide you through no-fault divorce proceedings with compassion and professionalism. Protect your interests.
SeoMetaPart.MetaKeywords: divorce solicitors Manchester, no-fault divorce, divorce proceedings, matrimonial solicitors, end marriage

Subheadline.Text: Navigate divorce with compassion and expertise. We guide you through the process with sensitivity, protecting your interests every step of the way.

Content.Html:
Divorce is one of the most challenging experiences you can face. At MCR Solicitors, we provide compassionate, expert guidance to help you through this difficult time while protecting your interests and those of your children.

No-Fault Divorce

Since April 2022, England and Wales have introduced no-fault divorce. This means:

  • No need to blame your spouse or prove wrongdoing
  • Joint applications are now possible
  • A simpler, less confrontational process
  • 20-week reflection period before conditional order
  • 6 weeks before final order can be applied for

The Divorce Process

  1. Application - File divorce application with the court
  2. Acknowledgement - Respondent acknowledges receipt
  3. Conditional Order - First decree after 20-week wait
  4. Final Order - Divorce is finalised after 6 more weeks

Related Matters

Divorce proceedings don't automatically resolve finances or children arrangements. We can advise on financial settlements, child arrangements, and ancillary matters.

SectionText.Text: A confidential discussion with one of our family law specialists can help you understand your options and the way forward.

SeoMetaPart.PageTitle: Judicial Separation Solicitors | Legal Separation Manchester
SeoMetaPart.MetaDescription: Expert advice on judicial separation. An alternative to divorce that allows you to live separately while remaining legally married. Understand your options.
SeoMetaPart.MetaKeywords: judicial separation, legal separation, separation agreement, separation solicitors, marriage separation

Subheadline.Text: An alternative to divorce that allows you to live separately while remaining legally married. Understand your options with expert guidance.

Content.Html:
Judicial separation is a legal process that formally recognises a couple's separation without ending the marriage. It may be suitable for those who don't want or can't obtain a divorce.

When to Consider Judicial Separation

  • Religious Reasons - If your faith prohibits divorce
  • Not Married Long Enough - You can't divorce until married for one year
  • Uncertain About Divorce - Need time apart before final decision
  • Pension and Inheritance - To protect certain spousal rights

How It Differs from Divorce

Unlike divorce:

  • You remain legally married
  • Cannot remarry
  • May retain certain spousal rights (pensions, inheritance)
  • No minimum marriage duration required

Financial Orders

As with divorce, you can obtain financial orders including maintenance, property division, and pension sharing through judicial separation proceedings.

SectionText.Text: Not sure whether divorce or judicial separation is right for you? Our family law team can explain the differences and help you decide.

SeoMetaPart.PageTitle: Financial Settlements in Divorce | Asset Division Solicitors Manchester
SeoMetaPart.MetaDescription: Expert help with financial settlements in divorce. Fair division of assets, property, pensions, and maintenance. Protect your financial future.
SeoMetaPart.MetaKeywords: financial settlement divorce, asset division, matrimonial assets, pension sharing, divorce finances

Subheadline.Text: Protect your financial future. Expert guidance on dividing assets, property, pensions, and maintenance in divorce.

Content.Html:
Financial settlements in divorce can be complex, especially when significant assets are involved. MCR Solicitors helps you achieve a fair outcome that protects your financial future.

What Can Be Divided?

  • Property - Family home and other properties
  • Pensions - Often the second largest asset after the home
  • Savings & Investments - Bank accounts, shares, and investments
  • Business Assets - Company shares and business interests
  • Debts - Joint debts and liabilities

Factors Considered

The court considers various factors when determining a fair settlement:

  • Length of the marriage
  • Each party's earning capacity
  • Contributions (financial and non-financial)
  • Needs of any children
  • Standard of living during marriage
  • Age and health of both parties

Types of Orders

We can help you obtain lump sum orders, property transfer orders, pension sharing orders, and periodical payments (maintenance).

SectionText.Text: Don't leave your financial settlement to chance. Our expert team will fight for a fair division of assets.

SeoMetaPart.PageTitle: Child Custody Solicitors Manchester | Child Arrangement Orders
SeoMetaPart.MetaDescription: Expert child custody and access solicitors. We prioritise your children's welfare while protecting your parental rights. Child arrangement orders and contact disputes.
SeoMetaPart.MetaKeywords: child custody solicitors, child arrangement orders, contact orders, parental rights, child access

Subheadline.Text: Putting your children first. Expert help with child arrangements that prioritise your children's welfare while protecting your parental rights.

Content.Html:
When parents separate, deciding where children will live and how they'll spend time with each parent can be difficult. MCR Solicitors helps families reach arrangements that work for everyone, especially the children.

Types of Child Arrangements

  • Live With Orders - Determines where the child primarily lives
  • Spend Time With Orders - Previously called contact or access orders
  • Specific Issue Orders - For specific decisions about the child's upbringing
  • Prohibited Steps Orders - Preventing a parent from taking certain actions

The Welfare Principle

Courts prioritise the child's welfare above all else. Factors considered include:

  • The child's wishes and feelings (age-dependent)
  • Physical, emotional, and educational needs
  • Effect of any change in circumstances
  • The child's background and characteristics
  • Risk of harm to the child
  • Capability of each parent

Our Approach

We encourage mediation and negotiation where possible, but we're ready to represent you in court if agreement can't be reached.

SectionText.Text: Let us help you create child arrangements that protect your relationship with your children while serving their best interests.

SeoMetaPart.PageTitle: Domestic Abuse Solicitors | Non-Molestation Orders Manchester
SeoMetaPart.MetaDescription: Urgent legal protection from domestic abuse. Non-molestation orders, occupation orders, and emergency injunctions. We're here to help you feel safe.
SeoMetaPart.MetaKeywords: domestic abuse solicitors, non-molestation order, occupation order, domestic violence help, restraining order

Subheadline.Text: You are not alone. We provide urgent legal protection and compassionate support to help you feel safe again.

Content.Html:
If you're experiencing domestic abuse, you deserve protection and support. MCR Solicitors provides urgent, confidential help to secure your safety and that of your children.

What is Domestic Abuse?

Domestic abuse includes:

  • Physical violence or threats
  • Emotional or psychological abuse
  • Controlling or coercive behaviour
  • Financial abuse
  • Sexual abuse
  • Stalking and harassment

Legal Protection Available

  • Non-Molestation Orders - Prohibiting abusive behaviour and contact
  • Occupation Orders - Determining who can live in the family home
  • Emergency Injunctions - Same-day protection in urgent cases
  • Power of Arrest - Attached to orders for immediate police action

Confidential Support

We understand how difficult it can be to reach out. All consultations are strictly confidential. We can arrange safe meeting places and times.

Emergency Help

If you are in immediate danger, call 999. For non-emergency support, contact us and we can often obtain protection orders within 24-48 hours.

SectionText.Text: Take the first step to protection. Contact us confidentially for immediate help and support.

SeoMetaPart.PageTitle: Pre-Nuptial Agreements | Post-Nuptial Agreements Manchester
SeoMetaPart.MetaDescription: Protect your assets with professionally drafted pre-nuptial and post-nuptial agreements. Fair, enforceable agreements that provide peace of mind.
SeoMetaPart.MetaKeywords: prenuptial agreement, postnuptial agreement, prenup solicitors, marriage contract, protect assets

Subheadline.Text: Protect your future together. Professional drafting of fair, enforceable agreements that give both parties peace of mind.

Content.Html:
Pre-nuptial and post-nuptial agreements are increasingly common among couples who want clarity about their financial arrangements should their relationship end. MCR Solicitors drafts fair, balanced agreements designed to stand up in court.

Pre-Nuptial Agreements

Made before marriage, these agreements set out how assets will be divided if you divorce. They can protect:

  • Pre-marital assets and savings
  • Business interests and shares
  • Inheritance expectations
  • Family wealth
  • Future earnings from specific assets

Post-Nuptial Agreements

Made after marriage, these serve similar purposes and may be appropriate when:

  • Circumstances have changed since marriage
  • One spouse receives an inheritance
  • A business becomes more valuable
  • You didn't have a pre-nup but wish you had

Making Agreements Enforceable

To maximise enforceability, agreements should be:

  • Entered into freely without pressure
  • Made with full financial disclosure
  • Signed with independent legal advice for both parties
  • Fair to both parties' needs

SectionText.Text: A professionally drafted agreement can protect both parties and avoid disputes later. Contact us to discuss your situation.

SeoMetaPart.PageTitle: Road Traffic Accident Claims | Car Accident Solicitors Manchester
SeoMetaPart.MetaDescription: Expert road traffic accident solicitors. No win, no fee representation for car accidents, motorcycle accidents, and pedestrian injuries. Maximum compensation.
SeoMetaPart.MetaKeywords: road traffic accident claims, car accident solicitors, RTA claims, whiplash compensation, vehicle accident

Subheadline.Text: Injured in a road accident? Get the compensation you deserve. No win, no fee representation for drivers, passengers, cyclists, and pedestrians.

Content.Html:
If you've been injured in a road traffic accident that wasn't your fault, you may be entitled to compensation. MCR Solicitors helps victims of car accidents, motorcycle accidents, cyclist injuries, and pedestrian accidents claim what they're owed.

Types of Road Accidents We Handle

  • Car Accidents - Collisions, rear-end shunts, T-bone accidents
  • Motorcycle Accidents - Often resulting in serious injuries
  • Cyclist Accidents - Injuries caused by vehicles
  • Pedestrian Accidents - Hit by cars, vans, or lorries
  • Passenger Claims - Injuries to vehicle passengers
  • Hit and Run - Claims through the MIB

What You Can Claim For

  • Pain and suffering
  • Loss of earnings
  • Medical expenses
  • Rehabilitation costs
  • Travel expenses
  • Vehicle damage and hire car costs

No Win, No Fee

We operate on a no win, no fee basis, meaning you only pay if your claim succeeds. There's no financial risk in pursuing your claim.

SectionText.Text: Don't settle for less. Our experienced personal injury team will fight for every penny you're entitled to.

SeoMetaPart.PageTitle: Workplace Injury Claims | Accident at Work Solicitors Manchester
SeoMetaPart.MetaDescription: Injured at work? Claim the compensation you deserve. Expert workplace injury solicitors handling accidents, industrial diseases, and employer negligence.
SeoMetaPart.MetaKeywords: workplace injury claims, accident at work solicitors, employer negligence, industrial injury, work accident compensation

Subheadline.Text: Injured at work? Your employer has a duty of care. We help you claim compensation for workplace accidents and industrial diseases.

Content.Html:
Employers have a legal duty to provide a safe working environment. If you've been injured at work due to your employer's negligence or failure to follow safety regulations, you may be entitled to compensation.

Common Workplace Injuries

  • Slips, Trips and Falls - Wet floors, obstacles, uneven surfaces
  • Manual Handling Injuries - Back injuries, muscle strains
  • Falls from Height - Ladder accidents, scaffolding falls
  • Machinery Accidents - Equipment failures, inadequate guards
  • Repetitive Strain Injuries - RSI, carpal tunnel syndrome
  • Industrial Diseases - Asbestosis, vibration white finger, occupational deafness

Your Rights

You can claim compensation even if you're still employed. It's illegal for employers to dismiss or treat you unfairly for making a claim. Your employer's insurance covers compensation payments.

Time Limits

You generally have 3 years from the date of injury (or date of knowledge for diseases) to make a claim. Don't delay in seeking advice.

SectionTitle.Text: Your Employer Should Be Held Accountable

SectionText.Text: Don't suffer in silence. Contact us for a free, confidential assessment of your workplace injury claim.

SeoMetaPart.PageTitle: Medical Negligence Solicitors | Clinical Negligence Claims Manchester
SeoMetaPart.MetaDescription: Expert medical negligence solicitors. We handle clinical negligence claims against hospitals, GPs, and healthcare providers. Get the answers and compensation you deserve.
SeoMetaPart.MetaKeywords: medical negligence solicitors, clinical negligence claims, hospital negligence, GP negligence, misdiagnosis

Subheadline.Text: When medical care goes wrong. Expert solicitors helping victims of clinical negligence get answers, justice, and compensation.

Content.Html:
Medical negligence occurs when healthcare professionals fail to provide an acceptable standard of care, causing harm to the patient. These cases are complex and require specialist legal expertise.

Types of Medical Negligence

  • Misdiagnosis or Delayed Diagnosis - Cancer, heart conditions, infections
  • Surgical Errors - Wrong site surgery, post-operative complications
  • Birth Injuries - Cerebral palsy, Erb's palsy, brain injuries
  • Medication Errors - Wrong drug, wrong dose, adverse reactions
  • A&E Failures - Missed fractures, delayed treatment
  • GP Negligence - Failure to refer, missed symptoms

What You Need to Prove

A successful claim requires evidence that:

  • The healthcare provider owed you a duty of care
  • They breached that duty (fell below acceptable standards)
  • The breach caused your injury or made it worse
  • You suffered quantifiable harm as a result

Time Limits

You generally have 3 years from the date of negligence (or date of knowledge) to bring a claim. Different rules apply for children and those lacking mental capacity.

SectionText.Text: Medical negligence claims are about more than money - they're about accountability and preventing future harm. Let us help you.

SeoMetaPart.PageTitle: Complaints Procedure | MCR Solicitors
SeoMetaPart.MetaDescription: Our complaints procedure at MCR Solicitors. We take client feedback seriously and are committed to resolving any concerns promptly and fairly.
SeoMetaPart.MetaKeywords: complaints procedure, solicitors complaints, legal ombudsman, client feedback

Subheadline.Text: We are committed to providing excellent service. If we have fallen short, we want to know so we can put things right.

Content.Html:
At MCR Solicitors, we strive to provide excellent service to all our clients. However, if you are unhappy with any aspect of our service, we want to hear from you so we can resolve the issue.

How to Make a Complaint

If you have a complaint, please contact us in one of the following ways:

  • In Writing: MCR Solicitors, 1024 Stockport Road, Manchester, M19 3WX
  • By Email: complaints@mcrsolicitors.co.uk
  • By Telephone: 0161 466 1280

What Happens Next

  1. We will acknowledge your complaint within 2 working days
  2. We will investigate your complaint thoroughly
  3. We will provide a detailed written response within 8 weeks
  4. If you remain dissatisfied, you may escalate to the Legal Ombudsman

The Legal Ombudsman

If we cannot resolve your complaint to your satisfaction within 8 weeks, you may contact the Legal Ombudsman:

  • Website: www.legalombudsman.org.uk
  • Email: enquiries@legalombudsman.org.uk
  • Telephone: 0300 555 0333

Complaints must normally be made to the Legal Ombudsman within 6 months of our final response and within 6 years of the act or omission.

SeoMetaPart.PageTitle: Privacy Policy | MCR Solicitors
SeoMetaPart.MetaDescription: MCR Solicitors privacy policy. Learn how we collect, use, and protect your personal data in accordance with GDPR and data protection laws.
SeoMetaPart.MetaKeywords: privacy policy, data protection, GDPR, personal data, solicitors privacy

Subheadline.Text: Your privacy is important to us. Learn how we collect, use, and protect your personal information.

Content.Html:
MCR Solicitors is committed to protecting your privacy and handling your personal data responsibly and in accordance with the UK General Data Protection Regulation (UK GDPR) and Data Protection Act 2018.

Information We Collect

  • Name, address, and contact details
  • Information relevant to your legal matter
  • Identification documents for verification
  • Payment information
  • Website usage data through cookies

How We Use Your Information

We use your personal data to:

  • Provide legal services and advice
  • Communicate with you about your case
  • Comply with regulatory and legal obligations
  • Improve our services
  • Send relevant updates (with your consent)

Your Rights

Under GDPR, you have the right to:

  • Access your personal data
  • Correct inaccurate information
  • Request deletion of your data
  • Restrict or object to processing
  • Data portability
  • Withdraw consent at any time

Data Security

We implement appropriate technical and organisational measures to protect your personal data against unauthorised access, alteration, disclosure, or destruction.

Contact Us

For privacy-related enquiries, contact our Data Protection Officer at dpo@mcrsolicitors.co.uk

SeoMetaPart.PageTitle: Legal Disclaimer | MCR Solicitors
SeoMetaPart.MetaDescription: Legal disclaimer for MCR Solicitors website. Important information about the use of this website and the limitations of the information provided.
SeoMetaPart.MetaKeywords: legal disclaimer, terms of use, website disclaimer, solicitors disclaimer

Subheadline.Text: Important information about the use of this website and its content.

Content.Html:
The information provided on this website is for general informational purposes only and does not constitute legal advice.

No Solicitor-Client Relationship

Using this website or contacting MCR Solicitors through this website does not create a solicitor-client relationship. A formal relationship is only established once we have agreed to act on your behalf and confirmed this in writing.

No Legal Advice

The content on this website is intended to provide general information about legal matters. It should not be relied upon as a substitute for specific legal advice relevant to your circumstances. Legal issues are often complex and individual, and professional advice should always be sought.

Accuracy of Information

While we endeavour to keep the information on this website accurate and up-to-date, we make no warranties or representations about:

  • The accuracy, completeness, or reliability of the content
  • The suitability of the information for any particular purpose
  • The availability of the website

External Links

This website may contain links to external sites. MCR Solicitors is not responsible for the content or privacy practices of these external websites.

Limitation of Liability

To the fullest extent permitted by law, MCR Solicitors excludes all liability for any loss or damage arising from your use of this website or reliance on its content.

Regulatory Information

MCR Solicitors is authorised and regulated by the Solicitors Regulation Authority (SRA). Our SRA number can be verified on the SRA website.

SeoMetaPart.PageTitle: Cookie Policy | MCR Solicitors
SeoMetaPart.MetaDescription: MCR Solicitors cookie policy. Learn about the cookies we use on our website and how to manage your cookie preferences.
SeoMetaPart.MetaKeywords: cookie policy, cookies, website cookies, cookie preferences, GDPR cookies

Subheadline.Text: Learn about the cookies we use and how to manage your preferences.

Content.Html:
This website uses cookies to improve your experience and help us understand how you use our site. This policy explains what cookies are, how we use them, and how you can manage your preferences.

What Are Cookies?

Cookies are small text files stored on your device when you visit a website. They help websites remember your preferences and understand how you use the site.

Types of Cookies We Use

Essential Cookies

These cookies are necessary for the website to function properly. They enable core functionality such as security, network management, and accessibility. You cannot opt out of these cookies.

Analytics Cookies

We use Google Analytics to understand how visitors interact with our website. These cookies collect anonymous information including:

  • Pages visited and time spent
  • How you arrived at our site
  • Your general location (country/city level)
  • Device and browser information

Functional Cookies

These cookies remember choices you make to improve your experience, such as language preferences or form data.

Managing Cookies

You can control and/or delete cookies through your browser settings. You can delete all cookies that are already on your computer and set most browsers to prevent them from being placed. However, if you do this, you may have to manually adjust some preferences every time you visit, and some services and functionalities may not work.

More Information

For more information about cookies and how to manage them, visit www.aboutcookies.org.
